overview: Michael Moskal has been the Vice President of the Information Exploitation Sector and Chief Information Officer for CUBRC, a non-profit research institution, since 2002. In this position, he has increased his annual revenue from $250k to $18 million. He is currently leading several best-in-class information fusion technology projects for the US Government. Prior to that, Michael was a Principal Engineer at Veridian where he managed a $4.5 million business. Since 2006, Michael has also been a Research Associate Professor for the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences at the State University of New York at Buffalo. Michael has authored or co-authored over 20 technical reports in the area of Information Science, one patent, and one provisional patent. Michael holds a Bachelors of Science in Industrial Technology from SUNY College at Buffalo and an MBA from Canisius College.

relationships.title: Vice President and Chief Information Officer, CUBRC
